data.text:
@david_avien @antibs247 I used to say our response was a black swan,
since we had the pandemic plans in place and knew the mistakes of the past.
But that was wrong of me.
The US has never gotten it right,
 I don’t know why I was surprised this time.

@david_avien @antibs247 I can cry thinking about it.
We knew waiting to act, kills. We know not using PPE/masks can be deadly.  We knew it during HIV, Ebola and post 911.
Front line workers, always get screwed the worst. 
Dr Fauic KNEW this, spoke about it many times.

@HomegrownJoan2 @antibs247 It is fascinating. I mean - as Detective Columbo would ask: why? I wonder why it went that way? There must have been a reason, and surely it can't have been to kill nurses. This will be interesting to discover when all this is (hopefully) over

@david_avien @antibs247 Pandemic preparedness plans were in place and those too were ignored.
We spent $6Billion on these plans. There is hell to pay when this is over. And the price of claims will fall on the taxpayer.

@david_avien @antibs247 US govt ignored the science of NPIs, prevention-
they knew this virus was spreading, yet sent 18tons of PPE to China-
They ignored nurses warnings/requests:

https://t.co/srQV3K3DSh

less than one month later,
nurses were dying, after caring for COVID19 pts without proper PPE.
@antibs247 To the point you attempted to make, that GMOs are less risk than vaccines. You’re incorrect. I’d recommend that you re-read those books. Taleb understands his material quite well.

@antibs247 Well, my take is,
why should poor farmers buy seeds when they can use non gmo and save seeds for their next growing season? It won’t cost them money

@HomegrownJoan2 @antibs247 Every govt does its best with scientific advice, approaches vary to suit the specific needs & populations, & then there is panic to manage, PPE to be resourced, pandemic infrastructure to create. Hindsight shows what worked/didn't. Humanity is brilliant

@antibs247 2/ and yet continued to drag their feet for ~ two months before offering info on masks, distancing.
Nurses had it right- the powers that be don’t value nurses experience... as MDs/scientists/health professors made a mockery of masks/precautions.

@antibs247 The entire response to this novel disease has been wrong.
The experts acted negligently. They went against their own published papers and spoken words at conferences.
They ignored the studies on the necessity of NPIs when a novel disease shows itself.
 It happened w/HIV, Ebola 1/
@antibs247 Vaccines don’t spread and evolve. That’s the point Mate. Don’t disagree that vaccine safety is critically important for these new technologies.
@antibs247 @SaadMaan15 I didn’t know he offered any other info on this vaccine other than potential risks would be individual, not societal.

@antibs247 @HomegrownJoan2 The scale of deployment is unprecedented indeed.

Still contained compared to FMOs.

Interesting you asked which vax.

If it messes with your DNA / reproductive organs it's becomes another thing since effects can spread through generations.

That's the closest you'll get to GMOs

@antibs247 @HomegrownJoan2 We're just comparing 2 very different things:

If u get a jab, the vaccine stops at you.

If you plant GMOs, you don't know where it stops. It's out in the woods, multiplying. Impacting people who didn't ask for shit.

That's NNT's problem with GMOs as per my understanding

@antibs247 Could very well be.
Ugh, this is hard.
I know nurses who’v said they’re seeing younger COVID19 patients... for now we are left to assess the best we can and make decisions on the risks we’re willing to take. 
Im older, and have immunity concerns that younger people don’t.

@antibs247 And I dont say “unscrupulous” lightly.
I despise Pfizer yet
I hope theirs and the other pharma corps are successful w/the vaccines.
Time will tell.
https://t.co/ZwNdPOvhBa

@antibs247 If it works and actually prevents Vitamin A deficiency, super!
GMO insulin helps diabetics.
I’m against the monopoly they have here in the US.

What good is GMO insulin if people can’t afford it?
https://t.co/hTR91OwC9i

@antibs247 We already have stats on RoundUp-Ready GMO.  
As anticipated, weed- resistance occurred causing more use of weed killer.

@antibs247 War, poor infrastructure, displacement/refugee, poverty, climate change are leading causes of starvation.
No seed, GMO or organic,
will help when a country holds back food in warehouses, and let’s their citizens die.

Starvation stats are up since GMO  have been approved. https://t.co/qkIAmO7JcG
@antibs247 @ishirubi Cherish your culture, in Europe and other parts of the world not yet pillaged by America. Say no to the freedom to destroy your birthright for a mess of foul pottage.
@antibs247 @ishirubi Earl Butz: "Go big or go home." When you get home, you see that we live in hell now. Ask Wendell Berry. Butz and company destroyed everything.

@antibs247 @ishirubi American logistics: "We cannot be communist, so trade must be free. Markets should be as big & free as possible. Interior lines are inefficient, per maximizing profit in massive markets, so fuck them."
@antibs247 @ishirubi The problem is that we require trade now. We cannot close vital lines. In military terms, we lack interior lines.
@ishirubi @antibs247 Europe is not America. We are zombis here: the living dead, already (cf. Paul Portesi on emergence). COVID showed us how we already committed suicide.

@antibs247 I know 2 truckdrivers. Both went and did drives in central-Europe, both still fine :/

There are measures taken over here, it looks like.
@antibs247 Supply chain can be dealt with - the drivers don't have to come in direct contact with warehouse workers etc.

@antibs247 As long as I am convinced this method would work best - covid vaccines become kinda irrelevant. 

In the future that means instead of flash vaccines we'll get temporary shutdowns of international travel... But unlikely as no one can earn money through it :)))

@antibs247 Listened to their most recent short talk with Yaneer - they disn't talk about vaccines at all. Best method to deal (was) with pandemics is not those and lock-downs, but lock-outs. Shutting down international travel, or enforce 2 week quarantine for those who need to travel...
@antibs247 (now, im not making any comments on the usefulness of the vaccines with it. i'd love to avoid both the virus and the vaccine, and still hope it will be possible)

@antibs247 you can reread, too. GMO poses a different kind of a risk, it's not about saving lives (which is nice in itself), but what kind of damage, irredeemable damge you can potentially do with it onto the ecosystem. vaccines can't do that.
